name: GJ 1265
scenarioDescription:
The GJ 1265 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 1265 is a star with 0.18 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.19 times its radius. It is located 33.46 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 1265 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 1265 system


GJ 1265 b

GJ 1265 b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1265 b is 7.40304 times the mass of Earth. At 7.40304 Earth masses, GJ 1265 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 1265, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Calar Alto Observatory.
